Thread Tree
[Thread Control Block]

Detailed Description

Management of a tree of thread.

Actually, both user and kernel threads need to fork themselves in order to do their jobs. The result of these fork operations is a tree of threads, and this module is useful to manage the tree.

Visit a thread tree:
void tcb_tree_visit(tcb_t *root)
{
        /* Operations on root ... */
        
        if(!emptyChild(root))
        {
        tcb_t *t;

                for(t = root -> t_first_child; t; t = t -> t_next_sibling)
                        tcb_tree_visit(t);
        }
}

tcb_t *tree = NULL;

/* Operations on the tree ... */

if(tree) {
        tcb_tree_visit(tree);
}
else {
        /* Tree is empty. */
}

Test whether or not a thread has children.
